member.name: T:ACMESharp.POSH.AcmeCmdlet
member.summary: Base class for all ACMESharp cmdlets implementing common logic.

summary.para: Gets the status and details of a Certificate stored in the Vault.
This cmdlet retrieves the details of a Certificate defined in the Vault. It is also used to export various artificates associated with the Certificate to various formats.
New-Certificate
Submit-Certificate
Update-Certificate
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Certificate request.
Optionally, specifies a file path where the private key associated with the referenced Certificate will be saved in PEM format.
Optionally, specifies a file path where the CSR associated with the referenced Certificate will be saved in PEM format.
Optionally, specifies a file path where the referenced Certificate will be saved in PEM format.
Optionally, specifies a file path where the referenced Certificate will be saved in DER format.
Optionally, specifies a file path where the referenced Issuer Certificate will be saved in PEM format.
Optionally, specifies a file path where the referenced Issuer Certificate will be saved in DER format.
Optionally, specifies a file path where the referenced Certificate and related artifacts will be saved into a PKCS#12 archive format.
Optionally, specifies a password to use to secure an exported PKCS#12 archive file.
This flag indicates that any existing files matching any of the requested export parameter paths will be overwritten. If not specified, existing files will cause this cmdlet to error.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.

Specifies a PKI tool provider (i.e. CertificateProvider) to be used in all PKI related operations such as private key generation, CSR generation and certificate importing and exporting. If left unspecified a default PKI tool provider will be used.
Lists all, or retrieves details for, Identifiers submitted for verification.

Use this cmdlet to list all of the Identifier that have been previously defined and submitted to the ACME CA Server of the current Vault. You also use this cmdlet to specify specific Identifier references (ID or alias) to retrieve more specific details as they are captured in the Vault.
New-Identifier
Update-Identifier
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Identifier submitted to the ACME CA Server for verification.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.
Completes a Challenge using a prescribed Handler.
Use this cmdlet to complete a Challenge associated with an Identifier defined in an ACMESharp Vault that has been submitted for verification to an ACME CA Server.
Get-ChallengeHandlerProfile
Set-ChallengeHandlerProfile
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Identifier submitted to the ACME CA Server for verification.

Specifies a reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Challenge Handler profile in the associated Vault that defines the Handler provider and associated instance parameters that should be used to resolve the Challenge.
Specifies the ACME Challenge type that should be handled. This type is expected to be found in the list of Challenges returned by the ACME CA Server for the associated Identifier.
Specifies the Challenge Handler instance provider that will be used to handle the associated Challenge.
Specifies the parameters that will be passed to the Challenge Handler instance that will be used to handle the associated Challenge.

If this cmdlet is invoked *in-line*, then these are the only parameters that will be passed to the handler. If this cmdlet is invoked with a handler profile reference, then these parameters are merged with, and override, whatever parameters are already defined within the profile.

When specified, executes the clean up operation associated with the resolved Challenge Handler. This is typcially invoked after the challenge has been previously successfully completed and submitted to the ACME server, and is used to remove any residual resources or traces of the steps that were needed during the challenge-handling process.
When specified, will force the decoding and regeneration of any ACME-defined heuristics and parameters for the given Challenge type.
When specified, forces the resolved Handler to repeat the process of handling the given Challenge, even if the process has already been completed previously.
Overrides the base URI associated with the target Registration and used for subsequent communication with the associated ACME CA Server.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.
Forces an attempt to complete the challenge even when the state of the current Identifier authorization is in a failed or completed state.
Invokes an Installer to install a PKI certificate.

Use this cmdlet to invoke an instance of an Installer Provider defined by a profile stored in an ACMESharp Vault. The profile will specify the provider name as well as any parameters that will be applied during the instance creation and invocation. Alternatively, you can specify all the details captured in a profile "inline" during this cmdlet's invocation.
Get-InstallerProfile
Set-InstallerProfile
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously retrieved and resolved Certificated provided by an ACME CA Server.

Specifies a reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Installer profile in the associated Vault that defines the Installer provider and associated instance parameters that should be used to install the certificate.
Specifies the Installer instance provider that will be used to install the associated certificate.
Specifies the parameters that will be passed to the Installer instance that will be used to install the associated certificate.

If this cmdlet is invoked *in-line*, then these are the only parameters that will be passed to the handler. If this cmdlet is invoked with a handler profile reference, then these parameters are merged with, and override, whatever parameters are already defined within the profile.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.
Initiates a request to issue a request for previously authorized Identifier.

This cmdlet is used to request a new certificate for a DNS Identifier that has already been verified by the ACME CA Server. It is also used to import, generate or define the certificate parameters and artifacts needed for the request, such as the private key and CSR details.
New-Identifier
Complete-Challenge
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined and authorized Identifier verified by the ACME CA Server.
Specifies an existing private key in PEM file format that should be used to generate the Certificate Request.
Specifies an existing CSR in PEM file format containing all the details of the Certificate that should be used to generate the Certificate Request.
Indicates that new Certificate Request parameters and artificats should be generated.
An optional set of certificate details to be included in the generated CSR.
For any elements that except multiple values (such as SAN), specify a string of values separated by space, comma or semicolon

A collection of one or more references (ID or alias) to previously defined and authorized Identifiers verified by the ACME CA Server which will be included in the X509 extension for the list of Subject Alternative Names (SAN).
There is no need to repeat the reference to the primary common name Identifier as it will be automatically included at the start of this list.
An optional, unique alias to assign to the Certificate for future reference.
An optional, human-friendly label to assign to the Certificate for easy recognition.
An optional, arbitrary text field to capture any notes or details associated with the Certificate.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.
Creates and submits a new Identifier to be verified to the ACME CA Server.
Currently, the only Identifier type supported is the DNS type.
Get-Identifier
Update-Identifier
Complete-Challenge
Submit-Challenge
Specifies the DNS name to be submitted for verification.
An optional, unique alias to assign to the Identifier for future reference.
An optional, human-friendly label to assign to the Identifier for easy recognition.
An optional, arbitrary text field to capture any notes or details associated with the Identifier.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.

Specifies a PKI tool provider (i.e. CertificateProvider) to be used by default in all subsequent operations against this vault. In most cases this can be overridden on a call-by-call basis but typically, all PKI-related operations should be performed by a single PKI Tool provider because of the internal workings of the provider and interdependencies of the operations. Such operations include private key generation, CSR generation and certificate importing and exporting. If left unspecified a default PKI tool provider will be used.
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Certificate request.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.

Specifies a PKI tool provider (i.e. CertificateProvider) to be used in all PKI related operations such as private key generation, CSR generation and certificate importing and exporting. If left unspecified a default PKI tool provider will be used.
Submits a completed Challenge for verification by ACME CA Server.

After a Challenge has been handled and completed, it needs to be submitted to the ACME CA Server that issued the Challenge. This cmdlet submits the Challenge of a particular type to the ACME Server to be verified. If the ACME Server issued multiple Challenges and combinations that will satisfy the validation of ownership of an Identifier, you can use this cmdlet to submit each Challenge type completed.
New-Identifier
Complete-Challenge
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Identifier submitted to the ACME CA Server for verification.

Specifies the ACME Challenge type that should be submitted. This type is expected to be found in the list of Challenges returned by the ACME CA Server for the associated Identifier and it should already have been handled previously, either externally to the ACMESharp operations or via the Handler mechanisms within.
Overrides the base URI associated with the target Registration and used for subsequent communication with the associated ACME CA Server.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.
Forces an attempt to submit the challenge even when the state of the current Identifier authorization is in a failed or completed state.
Updates the status and details of a Certificate stored in the Vault.
Use this cmdlet to update characteristics of an Identifier that are defined locally, such as the Alias or Label.
Also use this cmdlet to refresh the state and status of a Certificate including retrieving the certificate and intermediate signing certificate from the associated ACME CA Server.
New-Certificate
Get-Certificate
Submit-Certificate
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Certificate request.
Overrides the base URI associated with the target Registration and used for subsequent communication with the associated ACME CA Server.
When specified, this flag instructs the cmdlet to repeat the retrieval of the issued certificate and related artifacts (e.g. intermediate signing cert).
Indicates that updates should be performed locally only, and no attempt should be made to retrieve the current status from the ACME CA Server.
Optionaly, set or update the unique alias assigned to the Certificate for future reference. To remove the alias, use the empty string.
Optionally, set or update the human-friendly label to assigned to the Certificate for easy recognition.
Optionall, set or update the arbitrary text field used to capture any notes or details associated with the Certificate.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.

Specifies a PKI tool provider (i.e. CertificateProvider) to be used in all PKI related operations such as private key generation, CSR generation and certificate importing and exporting. If left unspecified a default PKI tool provider will be used.
Updates the status and details of an Identifier stored in the Vault.
Use this cmdlet to update characteristics of an Identifier that are defined locally, such as the Alias or Label.
Also use this cmdlet to refresh the state and status of an Identifier by probing the associated ACME CA Server for Identifier details.
New-Identifier
Get-Identifier
Complete-Challenge
Submit-Challenge
A reference (ID or alias) to a previously defined Identifier submitted to the ACME CA Server for verification.
Specifies the ACME Challenge type that should be updated.
Overrides the base URI associated with the target Registration and used for subsequent communication with the associated ACME CA Server.
Indicates that updates should be performed locally only, and no attempt should be made to retrieve the current status from the ACME CA Server.
Optionaly, set or update the unique alias assigned to the Identifier for future reference. To remove the alias, use the empty string.
Optionally, set or update the human-friendly label to assigned to the Identifier for easy recognition.
Optionall, set or update the arbitrary text field used to capture any notes or details associated with the Identifier.
Specifies a Vault profile name that will resolve to the Vault instance to be used for all related operations and storage/retrieval of all related assets.
Optionaly, set or update the unique alias assigned to the Certificate for future reference. To remove the alias, use the empty string.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.POSH.Util.PoshHelper.BeforeExtAccess
member.summary: This routine must be invoked from any CMDLET that relies on the Ext mechanism when running under POSH, but does not make use of Vault.

member.name: F:ACMESharp.POSH.Util.PoshHelper.PROBLEM_DETAIL_TYPE_URN
member.summary: Defines the well-defined ACME problem detail type URN prefix.

member.name: F:ACMESharp.POSH.Util.PoshHelper.PROBLEM_DETAIL_TYPE_TO_ERROR_CATEGORY
member.summary: Defines a mapping from well-defined ACME problem detail type URNs to POSH error categories.

member.name: M:ACMESharp.POSH.Util.PoshHelper.CreateErrorRecord(ACMESharp.AcmeClient.AcmeWebException,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructs an from an , populating as much detail as can be derived.
